chapters.title: Indications the attacker may not realize the potential capabilities of the malware they are using.

sentences.text: An unknown attacker is using a complex and powerful new malware loader in relatively unsophisticated and low-reward attacks, indicating they may not realize the potential capabilities of the malware they are deploying.
sentences.html: An unknown attacker is using a complex and powerful new malware loader in relatively unsophisticated and low-reward attacks, indicating they may not realize the potential capabilities of the malware they are deploying.

sentences.text: The malware, Trojan.Verblecon, is being used in attacks that appear to have installing cryptocurrency miners on infected machines as their end goal. There are some indications the attacker may also be interested in stealing access tokens for chat app Discord. However, the capabilities of this malware indicate that it could be highly dangerous if leveraged in ransomware or espionage campaigns.
sentences.html: The malware, Trojan.Verblecon, is being used in attacks that appear to have installing cryptocurrency miners on infected machines as their end goal. There are some indications the attacker may also be interested in stealing access tokens for chat app Discord. However, the capabilities of this malware indicate that it could be highly dangerous if leveraged in ransomware or espionage campaigns.

sentences.text: Verblecon was first spotted by analysts from Symantec, a division of Broadcom Software, in January 2022. This blog will detail the capabilities of the malware.
sentences.html: Verblecon was first spotted by analysts from Symantec, a division of Broadcom Software, in January 2022. This blog will detail the capabilities of the malware.

sentences.text: The malware is loaded as a server-side polymorphic JAR file. The fact that the file is polymorphic means that, due to encryption and obfuscation, the code of the malware payload looks different each time it is downloaded. Attackers generally pack malware in this way in an effort to evade detection by security software.
sentences.html: The malware is loaded as a server-side polymorphic JAR file. The fact that the file is polymorphic means that, due to encryption and obfuscation, the code of the malware payload looks different each time it is downloaded. Attackers generally pack malware in this way in an effort to evade detection by security software.

sentences.text: The malware samples analyzed by Symantec were fully obfuscated, in the code flow, strings, and symbols. The samples themselves may be based on publicly available code.
sentences.html: The malware samples analyzed by Symantec were fully obfuscated, in the code flow, strings, and symbols. The samples themselves may be based on publicly available code.

sentences.html: Once started, the malware checks its command-line arguments. It requires at least one command-line argument to execute, which could be the infection or campaign ID initially e.g.

sentences.text: Next, it attempts to detect if it is being opened in a virtual or sandbox environment, which would indicate it is likely being opened on a security researchers machine.
sentences.html: Next, it attempts to detect if it is being opened in a virtual or sandbox environment, which would indicate it is likely being opened on a security researcher’s machine.

tags.<code_0x603e4db2>:
import datetime
import hashlib
def dga(day):
 seed = bytes(day.strftime("%Y-%m-%d"), "ascii") + b"verble"
 md5 = hashlib.md5(seed)
 return md5.hexdigest()
print(dga(datetime.date.today()))

sentences.text: The server response body above is an encrypted blob that contains a URL signed with an RSA key. This blob can be decrypted and validated as follows:
sentences.html: The server response body above is an encrypted blob that contains a URL signed with an RSA key. This blob can be decrypted and validated as follows:

tags.<code_0x758a17ac>:
#!/usr/bin/python3
import Crypto.Cipher.AES
import Crypto.Hash.SHA256
import Crypto.PublicKey.RSA
import Crypto.Signature.pkcs1_15
import Crypto.Util.Padding
import base64
# from sample
aes_key = b"cYIoouG6CRk3ds6dZAfRdQOomHfxOFJ6"
aes_iv = b"FjP2PQfztKZ7vKxL"
rsa_certificate = ""
def disect_response(body):
 decoded_body = base64.b64decode(body)
 cipher = Crypto.Cipher.AES.new(aes_key, Crypto.Cipher.AES.MODE_CBC, IV=aes_iv)
 decrypted_body = cipher.decrypt(decoded_body)
 signed_message = Crypto.Util.Padding.unpad(decrypted_body, cipher.block_size)
 message, signature = signed_message.rsplit(b"@")
 print("message:", message)
 print("signature:", signature)
 rsa_public_key = Crypto.PublicKey.RSA.import_key(base64.b64decode(rsa_certificate))
 rsa_verifier = Crypto.Signature.pkcs1_15.PKCS115_SigScheme(rsa_public_key)
 message_hash = Crypto.Hash.SHA256.new(message)
 rsa_verifier.verify(message_hash, base64.b64decode(signature))
 print("signature verification: PASS")
disect_response("")

sentences.html: #!/usr/bin/python3 import Crypto.Cipher.AES import Crypto.Hash.SHA256 import Crypto.PublicKey.RSA import Crypto.Signature.pkcs1_15 import Crypto.Util.Padding import base64 # from sample aes_key = b"cYIoouG6CRk3ds6dZAfRdQOomHfxOFJ6" aes_iv = b"FjP2PQfztKZ7vKxL" rsa_certificate = "" def disect_response(body): decoded_body = base64.b64decode(body) cipher = Crypto.Cipher.AES.new(aes_key, Crypto.Cipher.AES.MODE_CBC, IV=aes_iv) decrypted_body = cipher.decrypt(decoded_body) signed_message = Crypto.Util.Padding.unpad(decrypted_body, cipher.block_size) message, signature = signed_message.rsplit(b"@") print("message:", message) print("signature:", signature) rsa_public_key = Crypto.PublicKey.RSA.import_key(base64.b64decode(rsa_certificate)) rsa_verifier = Crypto.Signature.pkcs1_15.PKCS115_SigScheme(rsa_public_key) message_hash = Crypto.Hash.SHA256.new(message) rsa_verifier.verify(message_hash, base64.b64decode(signature)) print("signature verification: PASS") disect_response("")

  • "pv" is "Admin" when running with Administrator privileges
  • "ip" is JAR pathname
  • "cn" is "[USER_NAME]@[COMPUTERNAME]"
  • "lr" has value "00:00:00"
  • "ct" has value "0"
  • "bv" has value "v1.0.0"

sentences.text: The payload is downloaded from the URL observed earlier:
sentences.html: The payload is downloaded from the URL observed earlier:

sentences.text: hxxps://jonathanhardwick[.]me/hardwick.jar
sentences.html: • hxxps://jonathanhardwick[.]me/hardwick.jar

sentences.text: The payload is obfuscated in a similar way to the other samples, and also contains similar techniques to detect the virtualization environment, as well as other functionality.
sentences.html: The payload is obfuscated in a similar way to the other samples, and also contains similar techniques to detect the virtualization environment, as well as other functionality.

sentences.text: The core functionality is to download and execute a binary blob from the following URL:
sentences.html: The core functionality is to download and execute a binary blob from the following URL:

sentences.text: hxxps://jonathanhardwick[.]me/hardwick.bin
sentences.html: • hxxps://jonathanhardwick[.]me/hardwick.bin

sentences.text: The blob is decrypted along with *.bin artifacts from the same host. The downloaded blob is then cached on the local filesystem (in re-encrypted form) and injected into %Windows%\SysWow64\dllhost.exe for execution.
sentences.html: The blob is decrypted along with *.bin artifacts from the same host. The downloaded blob is then cached on the local filesystem (in re-encrypted form) and injected into %Windows%\SysWow64\dllhost.exe for execution.

sentences.text: The injection is performed using com.sun.jna and doesn't use usual APIs for injection.
sentences.html: The injection is performed using com.sun.jna and doesn't use usual APIs for injection.

sentences.text: The final payload (hardwick.bin) contains the following embedded URL pointing to a configuration file for a cryptocurrency miner:
sentences.html: The final payload (hardwick.bin) contains the following embedded URL pointing to a configuration file for a cryptocurrency miner:

sentences.text: hxxps://jonathanhardwick[.]me/config[.]txt
sentences.html: • hxxps://jonathanhardwick[.]me/config[.]txt

sentences.text: This indicates that the purpose of this activity was to install cryptocurrency mining software on victim machines.
sentences.html: This indicates that the purpose of this activity was to install cryptocurrency mining software on victim machines.

chapters.title: What is the goal of this campaign?

sentences.text: The evidence found on victim networks appears to indicate that the goal of the attacker was to install cryptocurrency mining software on victim machines. This would appear to be a relatively low-reward goal for the attacker given the level of effort that would have been required to develop this sophisticated malware.
sentences.html: The evidence found on victim networks appears to indicate that the goal of the attacker was to install cryptocurrency mining software on victim machines. This would appear to be a relatively low-reward goal for the attacker given the level of effort that would have been required to develop this sophisticated malware.

sentences.text: There are also indications that the attacker may be stealing Discord tokens and using these to advertise Trojanized videogame applications.
sentences.html: There are also indications that the attacker may be stealing Discord tokens and using these to advertise Trojanized videogame applications.

sentences.text: We suspect they were stealing Discord tokens because some of the obfuscated strings refer to pathnames that are apparently related to Discord clients, specifically:
sentences.html: We suspect they were stealing Discord tokens because some of the obfuscated strings refer to pathnames that are apparently related to Discord clients, specifically:

sentences.text: "AppData\Roaming\discordcanary\Local Storage\leveldb"<crlf>"AppData\Roaming\discordptb\Local Storage\leveldb"<crlf>"Library\Application Support\discord\Local Storage\leveldb"<crlf>"Library\Application Support\discordcanary\Local Storage\leveldb"<crlf>"Library\Application Support\discordptb\Local Storage\leveldb"<crlf>".config\discordcanary\Local Storage\leveldb"<crlf>".config\discordptb\Local Storage\leveldb"
sentences.html:
• "AppData\Roaming\discordcanary\Local Storage\leveldb"
  • "AppData\Roaming\discordptb\Local Storage\leveldb"
  • "Library\Application Support\discord\Local Storage\leveldb"
  • "Library\Application Support\discordcanary\Local Storage\leveldb"
  • "Library\Application Support\discordptb\Local Storage\leveldb"
  • ".config\discordcanary\Local Storage\leveldb"
  • ".config\discordptb\Local Storage\leveldb"

sentences.text: Discord is a group chatting app that is particularly popular among the gaming community. Advertising Trojanized videogame applications via Discord is likely a redistribution channel for Trojan.Verblecon.
sentences.html: Discord is a group chatting app that is particularly popular among the gaming community. Advertising Trojanized videogame applications via Discord is likely a redistribution channel for Trojan.Verblecon.

chapters.title: Could this be used to distribute ransomware?

sentences.text: Most of the infections we saw where this malware was used were on non-enterprise machines; we rarely see ransomware deployed on non-enterprise machines.
sentences.html: Most of the infections we saw where this malware was used were on non-enterprise machines; we rarely see ransomware deployed on non-enterprise machines.

sentences.text: Previous reports have connected related domains to a single occurrence of ransomware, but the infrastructure may be shared with an unrelated actor. The similarities between that incident and the activity we observed includes:
sentences.html: Previous reports have connected related domains to a single occurrence of ransomware, but the infrastructure may be shared with an unrelated actor. The similarities between that incident and the activity we observed includes:

sentences.text: The use of verble in the domain name<crlf>The downloading of shellcode for execution<crlf>Similar obfuscation
sentences.html:
• The use of “verble” in the domain name
  • The downloading of shellcode for execution
  • Similar obfuscation

sentences.text: However, we do not have enough evidence to draw a definitive link between both these sets of activity.
sentences.html: However, we do not have enough evidence to draw a definitive link between both these sets of activity.

chapters.title: Power in the hands of an inexperienced actor?

sentences.text: The activity we have seen carried out using this sophisticated loader indicates that it is being wielded by an individual who may not realize the capabilities of the malware they are using. However, if it fell into the hands of a more sophisticated actor the potential is there for this loader to be used for more serious attacks, including potentially ransomware and espionage campaigns.
sentences.html: The activity we have seen carried out using this sophisticated loader indicates that it is being wielded by an individual who may not realize the capabilities of the malware they are using. However, if it fell into the hands of a more sophisticated actor the potential is there for this loader to be used for more serious attacks, including potentially ransomware and espionage campaigns.

sentences.text: File-based
sentences.html: File-based

sentences.text: Trojan.Verblecon
sentences.html: • Trojan.Verblecon

sentences.html: For the latest protection updates, please visit the Symantec Protection Bulletin.

sentences.text: If an IOC is malicious and the file available to us, Symantec Endpoint products will detect and block that file.
sentences.html: If an IOC is malicious and the file available to us, Symantec Endpoint products will detect and block that file.
